info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 06 at 5:10PM EDT until May 06 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Richmond County in east central Georgia... Edgefield County in central South Carolina... Southwestern Lexington County in central South Carolina... Northern Aiken County in central South Carolina... Saluda County in central South Carolina... Southeastern McCormick County in central South Carolina... * Until 545 PM EDT. * At 509 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Johnston to near Aiken State Park, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Aiken, North Augusta, Batesburg-Leesville, Aiken Mall, Belvedere, Clearwater, Edgefield, Saluda, Johnston, Ridge Spring, Clarks Hill Recreation Area, Edgefield County Airport, Hamilton Branch State Park, Citizens Park, USC Aiken, Saluda County Airport, J. Strom Thurmond Dam, Aiken Municipal Airport, Gloverville and Graniteville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 1 and 44. Interstate 520 in South Carolina between mile markers 20 and 23. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection seek shelter inside a sturdy building and stay away from windows.
